intro: Paraspalathus frankenioides, commonly known as the Frankenioides spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature in the genus. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, green leaves and produces clusters of yellowish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
